posts.post_content: This is a neat card, and I'm always drawn to cards dealing with enchantments; However, in regard to Brunsbr's deck idea, [Enchanted Evening](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enchanted Evening) will not allow you to function like that. It only affects permanents in play, not cards in your library.

Posted By: Oleander (6/7/2009 2:16:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
MULTIPLE EPIC SPELLS ARE FEASIBLE TO SET OFF. You need two in your hand (two of the same would work); a [quicken](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=quicken), [vedalken orrery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=vedalken orrery), or [leyline of anticipation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=leyline of anticipation); and ridiculous amounts of mana production (such as [Cloudpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudpost), [Glimmerpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimmerpost), [Vesuva](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vesuva) and [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice)) or mana reduction (such as the Planeshift familiars or [Cloudkey](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudkey)).  
  
Slap down one Epic spell, then before it resolves, quicken, then put another Epic spell on the stack. By the time one resolves, the other one's already been cast, and is not affected by "You can't cast spells". This has been confirmed by a MTG customer support representative via email.
posts.html:
MULTIPLE EPIC SPELLS ARE FEASIBLE TO SET OFF. You need two in your hand (two of the same would work); a quicken, vedalken orrery, or leyline of anticipation; and ridiculous amounts of mana production (such as Cloudpost, Glimmerpost, Vesuva and Mycosynth Lattice) or mana reduction (such as the Planeshift familiars or Cloudkey).

Slap down one Epic spell, then before it resolves, quicken, then put another Epic spell on the stack. By the time one resolves, the other one's already been cast, and is not affected by "You can't cast spells". This has been confirmed by a MTG customer support representative via email.

Posted By: Vinifera7 (10/11/2009 6:27:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is so fun to combo with [hive mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hive mind), if you can get it out your opponent will have to deal with the Epic ability too! to make things more fun use an [Enchanted Evening](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enchanted Evening) and an [Aura Fracture](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aura Fracture) to have complete control over your opponent. It's not like you'll be using too many lands after the epic ability resolves, and if you need more enchanted evening lets you fetch them whenever you need them!
  
   
The only bad parts about this card is it's high mana cost and that you need to build your deck around it to use it well...
  
   
I had mirror sheen in the comments before, appologies for a faulty combo.
posts.html:
This is so fun to combo with hive mind, if you can get it out your opponent will have to deal with the Epic ability too! to make things more fun use an Enchanted Evening and an Aura Fracture to have complete control over your opponent. It's not like you'll be using too many lands after the epic ability resolves, and if you need more enchanted evening lets you fetch them whenever you need them!

The only bad parts about this card is it's high mana cost and that you need to build your deck around it to use it well...

I had mirror sheen in the comments before, appologies for a faulty combo.

posts.post_content:
*"Haha, you can't play any more spells this game? That's a terrible card!"  
\*Ideal searches up Form of the Dragon, then Mystic Decree\*  
"...good game."*  
More likely, they won't just say "good game", they'll say "Lava Axe targeting you... good game"  
  
And what's with everyone giving love to [Enchanted Evening](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enchanted Evening)? Why the heck do you care that permanents are enchantments? Doesn't do anything for Ideal.  
  
As for you people with a blanket rule of "First turn always pull...Sterling Grove, Dovescape, etc."... There is no rule about your first turn except that on the first turn, you react to what's on the board and make sure you get a second turn. That could mean an [Oblivion Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oblivion Ring) or a [Faith's Fetters](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Faith's Fetters) or [Meishin, the Mind Cage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Meishin, the Mind Cage). Then probably a [Zur's Weirding](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zur's Weirding) so you can see your opponent's hand and make sure they can't kill you when you pull [Form of the Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Form of the Dragon).  
  
Seriously, ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

That could mean an Oblivion Ring or a Faith's Fetters or Meishin, the Mind Cage. Then probably a Zur's Weirding so you can see your opponent's hand and make sure they can't kill you when you pull Form of the Dragon.

posts.post_content:
Enduring Ideal can't combo with Mirror Sheen. It does not target anything.   
A card like Yavimaya Enchantress is great with this deck if you have Enchanted Evening in it. Ancestral Mask is also a great addition.   
Before playing the epic card, when you have Enchanted Evening out, try Wrap in Vigor and then Tranquility or Leave No Trace.
posts.html:
Enduring Ideal can't combo with Mirror Sheen. It does not target anything.
A card like Yavimaya Enchantress is great with this deck if you have Enchanted Evening in it. Ancestral Mask is also a great addition.
Before playing the epic card, when you have Enchanted Evening out, try Wrap in Vigor and then Tranquility or Leave No Trace.

Posted By: GrimjawxRULES (3/22/2011 3:55:50 PM)

posts.post_content:
My Enduring Ideal deck runs Hive Mind. Lol. I'll force Enduring Ideal on to my opponents (who more often than not or not running Enchantment decks). You don't want [Sigil of the Empty Throne](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigil of the Empty Throne). Sigil only works when you actually play the enchantment, not when you just pop one on to the battlefield.
  
   
Turn 1 with Enduring Ideal ALWAYS get [Dovescape](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dovescape).
  
Turn 2 [Solitary Confinement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Solitary Confinement) OR [Enchanted Evening](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enchanted Evening).
  
Turn 3 [Form of the Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Form of the Dragon)   
Turn 4
  
Turn 5
  
Turn 6
  
Turn 7 You win.
posts.html:

Turn 1 with Enduring Ideal ALWAYS get Dovescape.
Turn 2 Solitary Confinement OR Enchanted Evening.
Turn 3 Form of the Dragon
Turn 4
Turn 5
Turn 6
Turn 7 You win.
